result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Vaughn A Mikulance

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:59 AM Defendant Vaughn A Mikulance not in court, in custody.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson in court for Vaughn A Mikulance.  Prosecuting attorney Dirk Christian Jensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
Defendant has been extradited to Monroe County, Florida.  Defense waiting to hear how long defendant will be in Florida.
Status conference scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

11:21 AM Defendant Vaughn A Mikulance not in court.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson in court for Vaughn A Mikulance.  Prosecuting attorney Dirk Christian Jensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter: Saige Smith. 
Defendant does not appear.  Defense states that defendant does not appear due to 
As to 22CF354 Court finds a status was held and defendant was in Court and set status for July 18th.  July 18th defendant was not in Court and that defendant was currently in the hospital and a submission would be submitted and was set for August 12th.  On August 12th defendant was in Court and then set for September 23rd for status, however, on September 23rd Court was not available and case was rescheduled to October 31st which the defendant may be confused about the hearing dates.
An NGI evaluation was ordered earlier this year.  A letter from Dr. Goebel that defendant did not appear for his NGI evaluation.  Court again received another letter that defendant did not appear for his NGI evaluation.  An evaluation has never been completed.
Defense states that defendant did reschedule it and defendant has been in and out of Rogers Memorial lately.  Defense has spoken with Dr. Goebel's office about having the NGI completed. Defense is assisting defendant in having the NGI completed.
State believes trial will need to be rescheduled.
BTC: Case(s) removed from trial calendar.  Put back on calendar for 10/31/22 at 8:30 a.m.  Defense to check into if defendant is currently hospitalized.  Will not issue a warrant at this time.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Pretrial Risk Assessment Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

1:39 PM Prosecuting attorney Diane M. Donohoo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Vaughn A Mikulance appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney McKenna Marie Quinter in court for Vaughn A Mikulance. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
